meanings.definition: The process of converting physical assets into digital form.
meanings.sent1: Dematerialization is essential for businesses to transition to online platforms.
meanings.sent2: The dematerialization of books has revolutionized the way we access information.
meanings.sent3: During the dematerialization of the old house, it seemed to vanish into thin air!
meanings.sent4: Her artwork captured the dematerialization of nature, portraying it in a digital realm.
meanings.sent5: The dematerialization of currency made transactions quicker and more convenient.

meanings.definition: The act of making something immaterial or non-physical.
meanings.sent1: The magician's dematerialization trick amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers often discuss the dematerialization of the mind and consciousness.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the dematerialization of the villain added a supernatural element to the plot.
meanings.sent4: The dematerialization of emotions in his writing made the characters feel distant.
meanings.sent5: Her dance performance beautifully portrayed the dematerialization of boundaries between art forms.

meanings.definition: The disappearance or removal of material substance.
meanings.sent1: The dematerialization of the sculpture left only a faint outline behind.
meanings.sent2: The dematerialization of the ice cream cone was so quick that no one noticed.
meanings.sent3: The dematerialization of the cake at the party was a mystery that puzzled everyone.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the dematerialization of shadows created a surreal atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The dematerialization of the fog revealed a breathtaking view of the city skyline.
